business.headline: RVNL shares cross Rs 600 mark after jumping 5%. What's behind the rally?Shares of this multibagger railway PSU have sharply corrected over the past month but are still up over 230% year-to-date.

Reliance bonus issue: What is it and how will it benefit shareholders?A bonus issue, also known as a bonus share issue, occurs when a company distributes additional shares to its existing shareholders at no cost to them.

'Jan Dhan Yojana pivotal in boosting financial inclusion': PM ModiSpeaking at the Global Fintech Fest (GFF), he mentioned how the scheme has been a game-changer in ensuring that banking services reach every corner of the country.

UK's Aviva found guilty in $26 million fake invoice scandal in India: ReportBritish insurer Aviva has been accused of violating regulations in India by using fake invoices and secret cash payments to bypass commission limits for sales agents.

Vistara-Air India merger: Check impact on ticket bookings, flight operations and moreVistara-Air India merger: Travelers can expect expanded services and improved connectivity. Read on to see how this change will impact your bookings, flight operations, and travel experience.

No Vistara flight bookings from September 3 ahead of merger with Air IndiaVistara-Air India merger: Starting from September 3, 2024, customers will no longer be able to book Vistara flights for travel on or after November 12, 2024. Bookings for these routes will be redirected to Air India's website.

Premier Energies IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check status Premier Energies IPO allotment: Investors can check their Premier Energies IPO allotment status online via the BSE website or Kfin Technologies Limited, the issue's registrar.
Sensex, Nifty rally to new peaks as Moody's revises India's growth forecast to 7.2%Sensex, Nifty rally to new peaks as Moody's revises India's growth forecast to 7.2%
Sensex, Nifty open at record highs as Moody's lifts India's GDP forecast to 7.2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 502.42 points to 82,637.03, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 87.45 points to 25,239.40.

RIL AGM: Mukesh Ambani bullish on Reliance's growth; no word on Jio, Retail IPOsMukesh Ambani was bullish on the conglomerate's growth and said that Reliance was on track to more than double in size before the end of this decade.

Shah Rukh Khan enters Hurun India Rich List with Rs 7,300 crore net worthKnown for his recent hits like 'Jawan' and 'Pathaan', Khan's wealth isn't just from his successful film career but also from his stakes in the IPL team, Kolkata Knight Riders, which have significantly increased in value.
Sensex, Nifty end higher driven by gains in RIL stock The S&P BSE Sensex added 349.05 points to end at 82,134.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 99.60 points to close at 25,151.95.

RIL AGM: Reliance retail in top 5 globally in terms of stores The company also ranks among the top ten retailers worldwide in terms of market capitalisation and is in the top twenty for the number of employees.

RIL becomes India's first company to surpass Rs 10 lakh crore in annual revenueThis milestone was announced at the RIL AGM (annual general meeting), making Reliance the first Indian company to reach this landmark.
RIL AGM: Reliance Industries set to discuss 1:1 bonus shares on September 5RIL chairman Mukesh Ambani said that Reliance rewards its shareholders when the conglomerate grows at its AGM.
Sensex, Nifty hit record highs as financials and IT lead gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 361.46 points to reach 82,147.02, while the NSE Nifty50 added 85.70 points at 25,138.05
Paytm shares jump 5% today. Check price targetsPaytm plans to reapply for a payment aggregator (PA) licence, which analysts see as a positive move that may alleviate regulatory concerns.

Hurun India Rich List 2024: Check top 10, youngest billionaire and other details With India's billionaire count rocketing to 334, this year's list showcases an extraordinary leap, marking a sixfold increase since its debut 13 years ago.
Explained: Why IndiGo shares fell 3% in early trade todayAround 6% of the stake in IndiGo's parent company was sold in a block deal during Thursday's trading session.

Why Resourceful Automobile IPO disappointed investors after huge IPO bidsInvestors poured money into the SME IPO, as it got bids close to Rs 5,000 crore, which is huge for a firm that operates with just 8 employees and 2 outlets.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Era of uninterrupted dialogue over: S Jaishankar talks tough on Pakistan External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the focus is now on determining the nature of India's relationship with Pakistan, and that India will react to events, whether they take a positive or negative direction.

No reply on sensitive issue: Mamata Banerjee's 2nd letter to PM on rape-murderWriting to PM Modi again, Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee accused the Centre of not acknowledging her concerns and not appreciating the seriousness of the matter.

Hidden camera in girls' washroom in Andhra hostel, massive protests eruptA hidden camera was discovered in a girls' hostel washroom at Gudlavalleru College of Engineering in Andhra Pradesh, sparking a protest by the students.

How Shivaji statue collapse incident has exposed cracks in Mayayuti allianceThe growing tension among the Mahayuti alliance partners was palpable as the Shiv Sena, the NCP and the BJP spoke in different voices over the collapse of the statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

ISI's gift to hijackers of Indian Airlines plane in Lahore: Paper-wrapped pistolBefore IC 814 was hijacked and taken to Kandahar, the hijacking of an Indian Airlines plane in 1984 by Khalistani terrorists remained the longest in Indian aviation history. The hijackers faked weapons initially, but got a paper-wrapped pistol from Pakistan's ISI after they diverted the plane to Lahore. Here's the story of the hijacking of IC 421 on its 40th anniversary.

BJP 'forcing' Chief Secretary to quit, appoint Shinde aide: Aaditya ThackerayShiv Sena (UBT) leader Aaditya Thackeray chided the Maharashtra government over reports claiming Sujata Saunik, the state's first woman Chief Secretary, being forced to resign and make way for former BMC chief Iqbal Singh Chahal with Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's backing.
Acid attack, rain, and a gangrape-murder that shook Bengal 42 years agoA cold-blooded gangrape and murder on a rainy June night in 1982 left the town of Cooch Behar, in West Bengal, scarred forever.

Lured to hotel, stripped, assaulted: Actor's charge against director RanjithThe Malayalam film actor alleges that in 2012, he was summoned by filmmaker Ranjith to the Taj Hotel in Bengaluru in the guise of an interview, and was later forced to strip and sexually assaulted.

Video: Man assaults cab driver, slams him on ground for bumping into his luxury carThe taxi driver was admitted to a hospital and his statement was recorded by the police when he regained consciousness.

Just had pancakes, then...: Kamala Harris recalls Biden's call on stepping downPresident Joe Biden, who was up for re-election in the US presidential polls, dropped out of the race last month after mounting pressure from within his own party.

2 arrested for abetment to suicide in case of UP girls found hanging from treeTwo men have been arrested on charges of abetment to suicide in connection with the deaths of two Dalit girls who were found hanging from a tree in Uttar Pradesh's Farrukhabad.

Revanth Reddy regrets remarks on K Kavitha's bail: Highest regard for judiciaryTelangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy apologised on Friday for his comments about the bail granted to BRS leader K Kavitha, following a Supreme Court reprimand for alleging a "deal" between the BJP and BRS.

Why 'Tumbbad' is the most iconic blend of folk, fantasy and horror'Tumbbad' has been re-released in theatres seven years after it first hit the screens in 2018. Directed by Rahi Anil Barve, and starring Sohum Shah in the lead, here's why it is an out-of-the-world experience. Even in the literal sense of the term.

X suspends 'Barry Stanton' account after Indians outrage over racist postsThe action came after Barry Stanton's posts were flagged by hundreds of irate Indians, with several calling out Elon Musk for not suspending the account.

Zomato agent wades through knee-deep water to deliver order in flooded Ahmedabad. VideoA Zomato delivery agent waded through knee-deep water to deliver an order in a flooded area in Gujarat's Ahmedabad.

Biren Singh says 'whatever I did was for Manipur, why should I quit': ReportChief Minister N Biren Singh further questioned the calls for his resignation by the opposition over allegedly fanning the flames during the violent episode and favouring one community over another.
Woman fakes accident by falling in front of moving car in Bengaluru. VideoA woman faked an accident by deliberately falling in front of a moving car in Bengaluru. The video has gone viral.

Rahul Gandhi got Rs 1.40 crore from Congress for contesting from Raebareli, WayanadIn a report to the Election Commission, Congress said that it gave Rs 1.40 crore to Rahul Gandhi for fighting the Lok Sabha polls from Wayanad and Rae Bareli seats.

Fitness influencer hits bike rider, says 'Roz ka kaam hai' on cameraThe influencer later realised that the person in the backseat was recording the entire incident.

Man, 24, dies after SUV driven by 17-year-old hits his bike in MumbaiAn SUV driven allegedly by a 17-year-old boy hit a 24-year-old biker in Mumbai, killing him. The teen was arrested when he tried to escape after his SUV crashed into an electric pole.

Sudhanshu Pandey on 'brother' Rajan Shahi, and will he be back in 'Anupamaa' In an interview, actor Sudhanshu Pandey talked about his current equation with producer Rajan Shahi, amid the speculations of a rift between the two. He also commented on whether he would ever be back in 'Anupamaa' as Vanraj.

Rapper Hanumankind announces India concert, shares tour datesRapper-singer Hanumankind announced his upcoming India tour. Sharing a post on Instagram, the 'Big Dawgs' singer revealed that he would be performing in India this September.

'Kill' OTT release: Where and when to watch Lakshya's film'Kill' starring Lakshya, Raghav Juyal, and Tanya Maniktala, will stream on Disney+ Hotstar. The movie, known for its intense action and violence, received praise for its plot and performances.

sports.headline: Explained: Armless archer Sheetal Devi's awe-inspiring shooting technique Paralympics 2024: India's para-archer Sheetal Devi finished second in the women's individual compound archery qualification round with a score of 703 points. Born with phocomelia, a rare congenital disorder that causes under-developed limbs, she has risen to international prominence as one of the finest para-archers in the world.

Barbados Royals defend WCPL crown with thumping win over TKR WCPL 2024: Hayley Matthews' Barbados Royals won the title after beating Deandra Dottin's Trinbago Knight Riders by four wickets in the final at the Brian Lara Stadium.

Pressure on Pakistan as rain washes out Day 1 of 2nd Test in RawalpindiPakistan vs Bangladesh, 2nd Test Day 1: No play was possible in Rawalpindi on Friday due to persistent rain. Pakistan are in desperate need of a victory to level the series after Bangladesh shocked them in the city last week, winning the series opener by 10 wickets.

Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma should've played Duleep Trophy: Suresh RainaFormer India cricketer Suresh Raina feels star batting duo Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma should've played in the Duleep Trophy. Notably, the batting stalwarts weren't named in any of the four squads for the red-ball tournament.

Devine to resign as White Ferns T20I skipper after T20 World CupVeteran all-rounder Sophie Devine said that she will step down as the New Zealand in T20Is after the World Cup, but will continue leading the White Ferns in ODIs.

ENG vs SL: Joe Root remembers Graham Thorpe after record-levelling ton at Lord'sStar England batter Joe Root remembered former England cricketer Graham Thorpe after his record-levelling ton against Sri Lanka on Day 1 of the second Test at Lord's.

US Open: Daniil Medvedev breezes past Fábián Marozsán to advance to third roundDaniil Medvedev beat Fábián Marozsán by 6-3, 6-2, 7-6 (5) at Louis Armstrong Stadium to advance to the third round of the US Open.

US Open: Karolína Muchová knocks out Naomi Osaka in second round after thrillerKarolína Muchová knocked out two-time champion Naomi Osaka in the second round of the US Open women's singles at Arthur Ashe Stadium.

US Open: Elena Rybakina withdraws from US Open due to injuryElena Rybakina's US Open run ended in disappointment as the world number four withdrew due to injury before her second-round match, dashing her hopes of finally making a deep run at the only Grand Slam she hasn't mastered yet.

US Open: Bopanna-Ebden make winning start, Iga Switek storms into Round 3US Open Day 4 saw Rohan Bopanna and Matthew Ebden kick off their campaign with a strong-fought win in their men's doubles first round clash against Haase and Arends. On the same day, Iga Swaitek eased past Ena Shibara to move into round three.

In love with New York, Jannik Sinner eases into Round 3 after 'special 50'US Open 2024: Jannik Sinner became the first man to complete 50 wins on the tour in men's singles in 2024. He achieved the milestone when he hammered USA's Alex Michelsen 6-4, 6-0, 6-2 in the second round on Thursday, August 29.

Champions League set for new era: Madrid vs Liverpool, Barcelona vs BayernAs the UEFA Champions League steps into a new era under its brand-new format, the league phase draw on August 29 has revealed who the top European sides will go up against in the competition. Real Madrid against Liverpool, Barcelona against Bayern Munich are some of the headline clashes.

India at Paralympics, Day 2 Full Schedule: Medal events begin in para-athletics Paralympics 2024 India Schedule Day 2 (August 30): Team India will look to open its medal tally at the 2024 Paris Paralympic Games on Friday, with Avani Lekhara and Manish Narwal set to kick off their campaigns.

Jasmine Paolini continues dream run in 2024, Anna Kalinskaya advancesUS Open 2024: Jasmine Paolini continued her dream run this year, progressing to the third round of the US Open for the first time in her career. She spent less than 10 minutes on the court on Thursday as her opponent -- former World No. 1 Karolina Pliskova, retired in the first game after an ankle injury.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
